programme.title: The Arena
programme.desc: A thought-provoking forum to discuss topics occurring on and off the court of play. (live).

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.sub-title: Golden State Warriors at Dallas Mavericks
programme.desc: Golden State Warriors at Dallas Mavericks. From American Airlines Center. (live).

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.sub-title: Denver Nuggets at Los Angeles Lakers
programme.desc: Denver Nuggets at Los Angeles Lakers. From Staples Center. (live).

programme.title: Inside the NBA
programme.desc: Pro-basketball news and discussion among former players including Charles Barkley and Kenny Smith. Ernie Johnson hosts. (live).

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.sub-title: Golden State Warriors at Dallas Mavericks
programme.desc: Golden State Warriors at Dallas Mavericks. From American Airlines Center.

programme.title: Bones
programme.sub-title: The Final Chapter: The Scare in the Score
programme.desc: Booth delves into his past when dead bodies start turning up around Washington, D.C., that are linked to his old Army unit. Meanwhile, Brennan worries about her father but wonders if she can trust him after he doesn't tell her about a medical procedure. (repeat).

programme.title: Bones
programme.sub-title: The Final Chapter: The Grief and the Girl
programme.desc: Grief over a recent loss creates a rift between Booth and Brennan, who is also surprised by a visit from an ex-boyfriend. (repeat).

programme.title: Bones
programme.sub-title: The Final Chapter: The Steal in the Wheels
programme.desc: A hay-baler accident that claims a young man's life sends Booth, Brennan and Aubrey undercover in the cutthroat world of demolition derbies. Meanwhile, Dr. Gordon Wyatt show up to help Hodgins and Cam chart a new course in the Gormogon investigation. (repeat).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: An "NCIS" spin-off set in the Big Easy begins with the New Orleans field office investigating a murder case with ties to the military. The case gets personal for Pride when the victim is identified as a man he mentored as a young gang member who became an upstanding petty officer. Meanwhile, NCIS special agent Meredith Brody acclimates to life in the Crescent City. (repeat).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A Navy lieutenant on liberty dies from the bubonic plague. Special agent DiNozzo is sent from Washington, D.C., to help the New Orleans team locate all additional sailors on liberty, prevent a potential outbreak and determine the source of the highly infectious disease. (repeat).

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: The sisters travel back to the 1970s to prevent their mom (Finola Hughes) from making a pact with a warlock (Andrew Jackson) that makes him immune to their powers. Unfortunately, their mom---who's pregnant with Phoebe---and grandmother think the ladies are warlocks. (repeat).

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Prue (Shannen Doherty) must help a man escape from his evil, sorcerous family, as well as his own dark nature. Phoebe: Alyssa Milano. Piper: Holly Marie Combs. (repeat).

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Prue (Shannen Doherty), Piper, and Phoebe must save two boys who have been kidnapped by sight-stealing demons. Piper: Holly Marie Combs. Phoebe: Alyssa Milano. (repeat).

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Prue (Shannen Doherty) and Phoebe must contend with an evil ghost looking for revenge against the people who executed him. Phoebe: Alyssa Milano. Piper: Holly Marie Combs. (repeat).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Sebastian receives a plea for help from his high-school friend Adrian Conner after her business partner is killed at the Crescent City Gaming Convention. Also, FBI Special Agent Raymond Isler believes Adrian is a hacker the Cyber Crimes division has been tracking for years. (repeat).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A petty officer's murder leads the team to a family-owned night club where Pride's mother used to perform weekly. Also, Lasalle must urgently return home to Alabama after receiving an unexpected call from his family. (repeat).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The NCIS team investigates the murder of a petty officer who was in town to help a refugee family being recruited by terrorists. Also, Wade works on the special election campaign for Mayor Zahra Taylor that takes place during Mardi Gras. (repeat).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: FBI Special Agent Raymond Isler asks Pride for help with an off-the-books opioids theft investigation he is personally invested in. Also, Percy is sent undercover as a getaway driver with Isler as the muscle for a job tied to the case. (repeat).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: NCIS investigates the disappearance of a congressional aide after a hitman saves her from two men posing as NCIS agents. Also, Lasalle struggles with life-altering decisions regarding his brother's future. (repeat).

programme.title: Bones
programme.sub-title: The Final Chapter: The Radioactive Panthers in the Party
programme.desc: The battered and burning body of an up-and-coming filmmaker lands on a moving car, opening an investigation of unusual locations and characters linked to his movie. Meanwhile, Brennan gets advice from Dr. Mayer on work and romance; and Booth makes way for Aubrey to take the lead on the current case. (repeat).

programme.title: Bones
programme.sub-title: The Final Chapter: The Day in the Life
programme.desc: News of Kovac's escape sends Booth scurrying to protect himself and those closest to him from the killer's most dangerous plan to date. Meanwhile, Brennan testifies on Zach's behalf at his trial; and Aubrey and Jessica come to terms about their future together. (repeat).

programme.title: Bones *
programme.sub-title: The Final Chapter: The End in the End
programme.desc: In the series finale, Kovac is still on the loose as the team look for evidence to track him down, but they'll have to do it without Brennan after she experiences a setback, and their task isn't made any easier when it appears he's got outside help and a hideout. Series star David Boreanaz directs. (new).

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Temperance (Emily Deschanel) is called in by the FBI to help on a case and identifies the body of a missing intern who was involved with a married senator. Seeley: David Boreanaz. Zack: Eric Millegan. Ken Thompson: Sam Trammell. Oliver Laurier: Chris Conner. Sen. Bethlehem: Larry Poindexter. Hodgins: TJ Thyne. Angela: Michaela Conlin. Goodman: Jonathan Adams. (repeat).

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Temperance works on a case where a man exploded a car at an outdoor café, killing and injuring several occupants. Santana: Jose Zuniga. Gibson: Dave Roberson. Farid Masruk: Nicholas Massouh. Sahar Masruk: Bahar Soomekh. Tessa Jankow: Ane Dudek. (repeat).

programme.title: The Ugly Truth
programme.desc: This breezy romantic comedy stars Katherine Heigl as a lovelorn television producer who argues with a chauvinist TV-show host over the best way to attract the opposite sex.

programme.title: The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This raucous action comedy centers on bounty hunter Milo and his attempts to bring his reporter ex-wife Nicole to justice after she skips bail in order to investigate the cover-up of a murder. As she tries to give him the slip, the duo bicker incessantly and work through some of the problems that ended their marriage.

programme.title: Fool's Gold
programme.desc: Kate Hudson and Matthew McConaughey ("How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days") reteam for a picturesque romantic adventure about a pair of divorced treasure hunters who are thrown together when one finds a clue to the whereabouts of a fortune in Spanish gold. Donald Sutherland, Ray Winstone, Alexis Dziena. (repeat).

programme.title: The Glass Castle *
programme.desc: In this moving drama based on a memoir by Jeannette Walls, a young woman reflects on her unconventional upbringing at the hands of her artsy, nonconformist parents. Now married to a man who works in finance in New York, she faces criticism from her parents that she's betrayed their values. (new).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: An armored transport bus carrying Naval brig detainees crashes and four prisoners escape, including a black market broker who is one of the country's biggest national security threats. Pride turns to Gibbs for assistance when a case file needed for the investigation is full of redactions. (repeat).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: During the annual Contraband Days pirate festival, the NCIS team investigates the murder of a Navy captain who was searching for a valuable 200-year-old marble and gold fleur-de-lis. (repeat).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride, Sebastian and Tammy travel to South America after Pride is personally requested by a former colleague to assist with a classified operation that has been compromised. (repeat).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Percy and Lasalle go undercover at a high-stakes, underground poker game after the organizer targets players with access to a naval research laboratory. Also, Laurel Pride visits her dad during spring break to discuss options after her upcoming graduation. (repeat).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride and his bar patrons, including Sydney Halliday, who is visiting Pride after leaving the Army, are held hostage by a group of volatile thieves. (repeat).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Gregorio calls on Clair McGrady when the team's case matcher the one she studied during FBI training. (repeat).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When journalist Oliver Crane posts a scathing article documenting Pride's "reckless use of justice," the team is concerned about the fallout from the piece and the confidential information included in the story. Also, Rita Devereaux warns Pride that someone in D.C. has coordinated this attack on him, and the article is just the beginning. (repeat).

programme.title: The Ugly Truth
programme.desc: This breezy romantic comedy stars Katherine Heigl as a lovelorn television producer who argues with a chauvinist TV-show host over the best way to attract the opposite sex. (repeat).

programme.title: Ghosts of Girlfriends Past
programme.desc: A womanizer is haunted by his many old flames while attending his brother's wedding in this rollicking romantic comedy starring Matthew McConaughey. Having conquered almost the entire bridal party, libidinous celebrity photographer Connor Mead ponders bedding the bride's mother until the Ghosts of Girlfriends Past guide him on an eye-opening tour of his romantic past, present and future. Hilarity blends with heartache as they attempt to discern whether Connor will ever be able to mend his ways. (repeat).

programme.title: Fool's Gold
programme.desc: Kate Hudson and Matthew McConaughey ("How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days") reteam for a picturesque romantic adventure about a pair of divorced treasure hunters who are thrown together when one finds a clue to the whereabouts of a fortune in Spanish gold. Donald Sutherland, Ray Winstone, Alexis Dziena. (repeat).

programme.title: Life of the Party
programme.desc: Fresh off a divorce from a 23-year marriage, a mom in her 40s decides to finally get her degree and joins her daughter at college. There, she enjoys life on campus, crazy parties, and library hookups while coming to terms with her new situation.

programme.title: The Heat
programme.desc: A by-the-book FBI agent partners with an abrasive Boston cop to take down a powerful drug lord in this hilarious buddy comedy.

programme.title: The Heat
programme.desc: A by-the-book FBI agent partners with an abrasive Boston cop to take down a powerful drug lord in this hilarious buddy comedy.

programme.title: Life of the Party
programme.desc: Fresh off a divorce from a 23-year marriage, a mom in her 40s decides to finally get her degree and joins her daughter at college. There, she enjoys life on campus, crazy parties, and library hookups while coming to terms with her new situation.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A Navy SEAL is found murdered in a sorority house. The NCIS team investigate to determine if the motive pertained to one of his classified missions or whether the death was the result of collegiate foul play. Meanwhile, Pride's daughter visits the NCIS office. (repeat).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A chief warrant officer who specialized in counterintelligence is murdered. The investigation reveals the victim's wife has been kidnapped and is being held for ransom. Meanwhile, senior FBI agent Fornell travels to the Big Easy to assist with the case. (repeat).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A Naval staff judge advocate is murdered on Halloween and found in a cemetery dressed in a Victorian costume with vampiric puncture wounds on her neck. Meanwhile, the team members discuss what Halloween activity and costumes would be best. (repeat).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Part 1 of 2. Pride assembles an off-the-books team to search for a loophole when he faces a grand jury indictment for abuse of power. (repeat).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Conclusion. Pride and the team uncover a sinister plot during the New Orleans Tricentennial Fleet Week celebration. The Season 4 finale. (repeat).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: An "NCIS" spin-off set in the Big Easy begins with the New Orleans field office investigating a murder case with ties to the military. The case gets personal for Pride when the victim is identified as a man he mentored as a young gang member who became an upstanding petty officer. Meanwhile, NCIS special agent Meredith Brody acclimates to life in the Crescent City. (repeat).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A Navy lieutenant on liberty dies from the bubonic plague. Special agent DiNozzo is sent from Washington, D.C., to help the New Orleans team locate all additional sailors on liberty, prevent a potential outbreak and determine the source of the highly infectious disease. (repeat).

programme.title: Man of Steel
programme.desc: In this superhero stunner, after being sent to Earth from planet Krypton by his parents with a special object from his home planet in tow, Clark Kent grows up with the help of his earthly adopted parents and later assumes the identity of Superman and sets out to defend Earth from the villainous General Zod. (repeat).

programme.title: Suicide Squad
programme.desc: In this wild and anarchic "super-antihero" film, a team of incarcerated villains, including Deadshot, Harley Quinn, Enchantress, El Diablo and Killer Croc, are recruited by the government for a dangerous mission in exchange for reduced sentences. (repeat).

actor.role: Dr Harleen F. Quinzel / Harley Quinn

programme.title: Justice League
programme.desc: In this exciting comic-book adventure, Batman and Wonder Woman recruit superpowered individuals to defend humanity from an otherworldly threat called Steppenwolf. Together with their new allies—Cyborg, Aquaman and the Flash—they form the Justice League. (repeat).

programme.title: Fade to Black
programme.desc: Rapper Jay-Z, one of the best in the business, headlines this excellent concert recorded in New York City's Madison Square Garden in November 2003. The film also features interviews with Jay-Z and his producers in a Los Angeles studio, and on-stage performances by Beyonce, Mary J. Blige, Foxy Brown, Ghostface Killah, Missy Elliott, ?uestlove and R. Kelly.

programme.title: Gone Baby Gone
programme.desc: Ben Affleck makes an impressive directorial debut with this gritty thriller about two street-smart private eyes (Casey Affleck, Michelle Monaghan) investigating the mysterious disappearance of a little girl in a working-class Boston neighborhood. Morgan Freeman, Ed Harris, John Ashton, Amy Ryan, Amy Madigan.

programme.title: First Reformed
programme.desc: The pastor of a small church in New York with dwindling attendance gets a call from a pregnant parishioner begging for help with her extremely radical husband. After getting involved, the pastor loses control of every aspect of his life.

programme.title: Enemy
programme.desc: Adam Bell is a glum professor who has grown disinterested by his ordinary life. When Adam discovers a man who appears to be his double, the identical men meet and their lives become bizarrely and hauntingly intertwined.

programme.title: Locke
programme.desc: In this tense and ingenious drama that takes place over the course of a night drive, a construction manager receives a crucial phone call that shakes his world and sparks a tragic chain of events that threaten to destroy his entire life.

programme.title: The Boondock Saints II: All Saints Day
programme.desc: The MacManus brothers (Norman Reedus and Sean Patrick Flanery) return to take on the mob after a local priest is killed in cold blood, and the result is a wild trip through the violent Boston underworld. Billy Connolly, Clifton Collins Jr., Julie Benz. Directed by Troy Duffy.

programme.title: A Prayer Before Dawn
programme.desc: A young Englishman hits rock bottom in Thailand and is sent to one of the country's most notorious prisons. While attempting to overcome his drug addiction, he is offered the chance to compete in brutal Muay Thai boxing tournaments to potentially earn his freedom.

programme.title: First Reformed
programme.desc: The pastor of a small church in New York with dwindling attendance gets a call from a pregnant parishioner begging for help with her extremely radical husband. After getting involved, the pastor loses control of every aspect of his life.

programme.title: The Queen
programme.desc: Helen Mirren's Oscar-winning portrayal of Britain's Queen Elizabeth II propels this sharply intelligent reimagining of the royalty's response to the death of Princess Diana in 1997.

programme.title: Last Night
programme.desc: While a man is away on a business trip, his wife (Keira Knightley) considers cheating on him with an old flame in this intimate drama. Meanwhile, he finds himself drawn to a sultry new coworker. Directed by Massy Tadjedin.

programme.title: Being John Malkovich
programme.desc: Wildly inventive dark comedy about a puppeteer who gains access to John Malkovich's brain via a small portal in his office. Later, a love triangle forms when he and his wife both have affairs with one of his coworkers while inhabiting Malkovich's body.

programme.title: Mr. Mom
programme.desc: Family man Jack Butler is happily married and lives with his beloved wife Caroline Butler and their children Alex, Kenny and Megan in a suburb of Detroit. After he's laid off, he switches roles with Caroline.She returns to the workforce, and he becomes a stay-at-home dad, a job he has no clue how to do.

programme.title: Risky Business
programme.desc: A teenager with a bright future turns his house into a brothel while his parents are away, falls for a prostitute and earns the wrath of Guido the Killer Pimp in this comedy highlighted by Tom Cruise's star-making performance.

programme.title: The Blues Brothers
programme.desc: Two soul-singing brothers are sent on a "mission from God" to raise $5000 to save a Chicago orphanage. On their fund-raising tour de force, they encounter a multitude of mishaps and mayhem.

programme.title: Mob Town
programme.desc: In 1957, an FBI agent teams up with a local police officer to monitor the activities of New York City's most notorious Mafia leaders as they prepare for a large-scale gathering in upstate New York. It is up to the unlikely duo to piece together the purpose of such a meeting and thwart any instances of violence that may erupt as a result.

programme.title: Being John Malkovich
programme.desc: Wildly inventive dark comedy about a puppeteer who gains access to John Malkovich's brain via a small portal in his office. Later, a love triangle forms when he and his wife both have affairs with one of his coworkers while inhabiting Malkovich's body.

programme.title: Don Jon
programme.desc: Unrepentant womanizer Jon earns the nickname "Don Jon" for his ability to charm the ladies, but harbors an emotionally crippling addiction to Internet porn until two different women teach him the true value of intimacy in this poignant comedy-drama.

programme.title: Hot Summer Nights
programme.desc: An awkward teenager gets in over his head dealing drugs while falling for his business partner's enigmatic sister during one scorching hot summer in Cape Cod, Massachusetts.

programme.title: Team America: World Police
programme.desc: "South Park" creators Trey Parker and Matt Stone supply most of the voices for an all-puppet cast in this uproariously profane, razor-sharp satire. The film tracks a blindly patriotic cop squad on their quest to stamp out global tyranny and terrorism. Other voice talent includes Kristen Miller, Daran Norris, Maurice LaMarche and Masasa.

programme.title: Body of Deceit
programme.desc: A writer suffers from depression and nightmares after a terrible accident.

programme.title: Mob Town
programme.desc: In 1957, an FBI agent teams up with a local police officer to monitor the activities of New York City's most notorious Mafia leaders as they prepare for a large-scale gathering in upstate New York. It is up to the unlikely duo to piece together the purpose of such a meeting and thwart any instances of violence that may erupt as a result.

programme.title: Frances Ha
programme.desc: In this observant comedy inspired by films of the French New Wave, a twentysomething woman deals with romantic troubles, a failed friendship, unemployment and finding an apartment in New York City.

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: This delightfully offbeat comedy centers on a single woman who decides to conceive via artificial insemination. But seven years later, she reunites with a friend and comes to question the child's paternity after he recalls a last-minute mix-up involving the sperm sample she used.

programme.title: The Current War: Director's Cut
programme.desc: Electricity kingpins George Westinghouse and Thomas Edison find their rivalry escalating, plunging deeper into a brutal race to electrify the United States. Loyalties are tested and lines are crossed as the magnates vie to exert their influence across the nation and also bring their patented electrical system to the entire modern world.

programme.title: The Best of Enemies
programme.desc: Based on the true story of a reluctant partnership between civil rights activist Ann Atwater and C.P. Ellis, the leader of the Ku Klux Klan, who came together to discuss the issue of racial desegregation of schools in 1971 Durham, North Carolina, which eventually lead to surprising outcomes for them and the entire community.

programme.title: Morris From America
programme.desc: In this moving coming-of-age story, a 13-year-old African-American boy named Morris moves to Heidelberg, Germany with his widower father. There, he flirts with a classmate and deals with culture shock by immersing himself in hip-hop music.

programme.title: Coach Carter
programme.desc: Samuel L. Jackson brings his A-game to this inspiring and eloquent fact-based sports drama. He plays a no-nonsense California high-school basketball coach who demands that his cocky, undisciplined players be responsible on and off the court. Rob Brown, Robert Ri'chard, Debbi Morgan, Ashanti, Rick Gonzalez, Antwon Tanner, Nana Gbewonyo, Denise Dowse, Mel Winkler.

programme.title: Fast Times at Ridgemont High
programme.desc: A study of adolescent obsession with sex, drugs, and rock and roll has a girl seeking romance advice from an upperclassman on how to get a boy to notice her; and a stoner feuding with a teacher.

programme.title: Fright Night
programme.desc: Suburban teenager Charley realizes that his charismatic new neighbor Jerry is a vampire, and he turns to Las Vegas magician Peter Vincent to help exterminate the bloodsucker in this frightfully fun horror remake.

programme.title: Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark
programme.desc: Set in small town 1960s America, a terrifying mansion on the outskirts of town is home to a book of scary stories written by a young girl who was imprisoned there. Teens stumble across her book and must face their fears in order to survive.

programme.title: Child's Play
programme.desc: When a murderer is killed in a police shoot-out, he invokes a voodoo spell that allows him to transfer his spirit into a doll.

programme.title: Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark
programme.desc: Set in small town 1960s America, a terrifying mansion on the outskirts of town is home to a book of scary stories written by a young girl who was imprisoned there. Teens stumble across her book and must face their fears in order to survive.

programme.title: Child's Play
programme.desc: When a murderer is killed in a police shoot-out, he invokes a voodoo spell that allows him to transfer his spirit into a doll.

programme.title: The Best of Enemies
programme.desc: Based on the true story of a reluctant partnership between civil rights activist Ann Atwater and C.P. Ellis, the leader of the Ku Klux Klan, who came together to discuss the issue of racial desegregation of schools in 1971 Durham, North Carolina, which eventually lead to surprising outcomes for them and the entire community.

programme.title: Poms
programme.desc: After moving to a retirement community, a woman is inspired to relive her high school days and start a cheerleading team with the fellow residents. The team takes off, but a shocking secret about the captain threatens to derail their training in this comedy film.

programme.title: Honey
programme.desc: Jessica Alba has all the right moves in this wholesome urban fairy tale. She plays a talented dancer who tries to balance her dreams of becoming a big-time choreographer with her devotion to a struggling community center in her old neighborhood.

programme.title: Obvious Child
programme.desc: In this utterly unique comedy, a twentysomething female comic attempts to embrace adulthood after getting dumped, fired and pregnant. In time, her newfound vulnerability helps her to nurture a renewed sense of self-confidence.

programme.title: Madea's Family Reunion
programme.desc: Tyler Perry directed and stars in this hysterical adaptation of his hit play, which chronicles the adventures of a gun-toting Southern matriarch who takes in a troubled foster child while trying to plan a family reunion.

programme.title: Working Girl
programme.desc: A blue-collar secretary at a Wall Street investment bank sees her fortunes improve when her domineering boss is incapacitated with a broken leg, allowing her to push her own ideas forward and rise to the top of New York's banking circles.

programme.title: The Captive
programme.desc: In this taut thriller, a father searches for his kidnapped daughter after new evidence suggests that she is still alive. Although years have passed since she disappeared, the revelation that she's being held in captivity offers hope for her safe return.

programme.title: A Walk Among the Tombstones
programme.desc: The thrills never stop when a NYC heroin trafficker hires a haunted ex-cop to find the men who abducted and killed his wife. But as the sleuth gets closer to his targets, he realizes that they're much more sinister than he could have imagined.

programme.title: Hostage
programme.desc: A small-town cop, tortured by a past failure as a hostage negotiator, is caught in the middle of two kidnappings in this stylish thriller.

programme.title: Hitman
programme.desc: A genetically engineered assassin known as Agent 47 finds himself on the run with a hooker after he is double-crossed on a mission in Russia. Timothy Olyphant and Dougray Scott star in the explosive unrated adaptation of the popular video game. Olga Kurylenko, Robert Knepper, Ulrich Thomsen. Directed by Xavier Gens.

programme.title: John Q
programme.desc: Riveting thriller about a family man whose son needs a lifesaving heart-transplant operation. When his health-care plan doesn't cover the boy's medical procedure, he takes drastic steps to rectify the situation.

programme.title: The Quarry
programme.desc: After killing a traveling preacher, a fugitive drifter poses as his victim and endears himself to a remote Texas town with his persuasive sermons on forgiveness. The local police chief, however, suspects that something is amiss and initiates an investigation after a body is found in the local quarry.

programme.title: Envy
programme.desc: Here's a true Black comedy. That's because it stars Jack Black. He's a blast as a suddenly successful entrepreneur whose best friend and neighbor (Ben Stiller) resents his buddy's good fortune and rues the fact that he blew the opportunity to join him in his wildly lucrative venture. Christopher Walken excels as a barroom philosopher who imparts some dubious advice to Stiller. Barry Levinson directed. Rachel Weisz, Amy Poehler.

programme.title: Half Nelson
programme.desc: This poignant and moving two-character study is set in a poor Brooklyn neighborhood where a junior-high student (Shareeka Epps) catches her dedicated and inspiring teacher (Ryan Gosling) getting high. Surprisingly, the two begin a tentative friendship that could lead to each other's salvation. Newcomer Epps earns an A-plus for an impressively restrained performance, and Gosling is also excellent. Directed by Ryan Fleck, who co-wrote the script with Anna Boden. Anthony Mackie.

programme.title: Witless Protection
programme.desc: It's "Blue Collar Comedy" star Larry the Cable Guy taking on white-collar criminals in this slapstick yukfest. Larry plays a small-town cop who mistakes a government witness for a kidnap victim (Ivana Milicevic) and "rescues" her from her FBI protectors, who might be corrupt from their well-polished shoes to their perfectly cut hair. Yaphet Kotto costars as federal agent Alonzo Moseley, the same character he played in 1988's "Midnight Run." Written and directed by Charles Robert Carner.

programme.title: Trail of the Pink Panther
programme.desc: A collection of outtakes from previous films in the series, plus added footage, form a new story about a jewel heist.

programme.title: Dodgeball: A True Underdog Story
programme.desc: Bound to stir up good and bad memories of an adolescent rite of passage, director Rawson Marshall Thurber's outrageous nerds-vs.-jocks comedy pits a misfit dodgeball team against a squad sponsored by a corporate giant. Ben Stiller, Vince Vaughn, Christine Taylor, Rip Torn, Stephen Root, Gary Cole, Jason Bateman, Justin Long, Joel David Moore, Alan Tudyk, Chris Williams.

programme.title: Altered States
programme.desc: A Harvard scientist subjects himself to a series of tests involving mind-altering drugs, hoping to explore different levels of human consciousness but he winds up gradually deteriorating into a primeval being.

programme.title: Stigmata
programme.desc: Patricia Arquette leaves her mark in a bloody, creepy chiller about a "self-confessed atheist" who "exhibits the wounds of Christ." Gabriel Byrne is riveting as a Vatican priest, a debunker of miracles, sent to investigate the religious phenomenon. He arrives and in due course witnesses a couple of terrifying incidents that rock his faith.

programme.title: Crimson Peak
programme.desc: In this terrifying gothic romance, a mysterious stranger woos a young woman and brings her to his mansion atop a clay mountain. There, she learns that her new home holds many disturbing secrets as she fights for her sanity and her very life.

programme.title: Poltergeist II: The Other Side
programme.desc: The Freeling family is once again spooked by supernatural forces in this sequel to the 1982 blockbuster. They're back for Carol Anne, and this time the Beast takes the form of a sinister reverend.

programme.title: The Cell 2
programme.desc: A psychic investigator attempts to stop a sadistic serial killer who repeatedly brings his helpless victims back to life over and over again until they beg to die. Tessie Santiago stars in this terrifying sequel to the 2000 cult horror movie. Chris Bruno, Frank Whaley, Bart Johnson. Directed by Tim Iacofano.

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: Prepare for serious thrills as a cop pursues a female android that escaped from a hedonistic resort where people live out their wildest fantasies. Meanwhile, the owner of the resort dispatches a band of mercenaries to eliminate the android first.

programme.title: Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Director Tim Burton reimagines the 1968 sci-fi classic in this visually stunning feature set in 2029. Mark Wahlberg stars as an astronaut who crash-lands on a planet where dignified apes rule with an iron fist and subservient humans are treated like chattel. Helena Bonham Carter, Tim Roth, Michael Clarke Duncan, Paul Giamatti, Kris Kristofferson, David Warner, Estella Warren.

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: In search of answers to his best friend's death, a cyber security hotshot working for the FBI enlists the help of his streetwise father to negotiate the dangerous and drug-fueled streets of Harlem. But it's a clash of style and identity in this action comedy film about settling scores.

programme.title: Hackers
programme.desc: High-school students stumble onto an embezzlement scheme and use computer wizardry to thwart the mastermind.

programme.title: Lady in the Water
programme.desc: In this mesmerizing horror fantasy, an apartment manager finds a sea nymph called a "narf" in the complex's swimming pool, and tries to return her to her natural habitat. However, otherworldly monsters are out to stop him.

programme.title: Shanghai Surprise
programme.desc: During the Japanese occupation of China, a prim missionary hires a con man to help her locate a stolen cache of opium to use on wounded soldiers.

programme.title: Orange County
programme.desc: Hollywood's next generation takes center stage as Colin Hanks (son of Tom) stars in this comedy from director Jake Kasdan (son of Lawrence). It's the story of a California high-school senior (Hanks) who jumps through hoops to get into Stanford after a mishap with his transcript. Schuyler Fisk, Jack Black, Catherine O'Hara, John Lithgow, Lily Tomlin, Chevy Chase.

programme.title: Before Sunset
programme.desc: Director Richard Linklater ("School of Rock") reunites with Julie Delpy and Ethan Hawke for this charming follow-up to "Before Sunrise." The story picks up nine years after their one night of romance, as the former lovers cross paths again in Paris. He's in France on a publicity tour for his book about their chance encounter.

programme.title: Black Rain
programme.desc: A tarnished New York cop and his younger partner run afoul of the Japanese Yakuza after escorting a crime boss to Osaka in order to stand trial.

programme.title: Walk the Line
programme.desc: Joaquin Phoenix and Reese Witherspoon give award-winning performances and do their own singing in this touching portrait of music legend Johnny Cash and his tumultuous love affair with June Carter. Ginnifer Goodwin, Robert Patrick, Dallas Roberts. Directed by James Mangold.

programme.title: Chasing Mavericks
programme.desc: In this inspiring sports drama, a young surfing prodigy enlists the help of an old pro in order to conquer a truly epic wave, and eventually the two surfers forge a bond of friendship that changes their lives.

programme.title: American Woman
programme.desc: Set in small-town Pennsylvania, a foxy grandmother in her early thirties struggles to make ends meet with her job as a supermarket cashier. She tries to provide for her 16-year-old daughter who's a single mom. Once her daughter disappears after a night out, the narrative spans the next 11 years as she raises her grandson, attempting to find real love and seeking answers for the mystery which may come at last.

programme.title: The Man in the Iron Mask
programme.desc: In 17th-century France, the four musketeers devise a plan to replace the widely hated King Louis XIV with a twin brother who has been imprisoned for the past six years with an iron mask on his face.

programme.title: Lost Boys: The Tribe
programme.desc: A vampire hunter is called in after a surfer and his sister tangle with a tribe of bloodsuckers. Corey Feldman reprises his signature role of Edgar Frog in this thrilling follow-up of the 1987 cult favorite. Tad Hilgenbrinck, Angus Sutherland, Autumn Reeser, Jamison Newlander, Corey Haim. Directed by P.J. Pesce.

programme.title: Lost Boys: The Thirst
programme.desc: When an ambitious alpha bloodsucker disguises vampire blood as a designer drug in a bid to claim the entire planet in the name of the undead, it's up to Edgar and Alan Frog to fight for the future of the entire human race.

programme.title: Nurse 3D
programme.desc: In this bloody and intense horror film, a sexy nurse moonlights as a man-hating murderess until a younger coworker threatens to expose her.

programme.title: 2 Days in the Valley
programme.desc: When a bungled contract killing turns a hitman's partner against him, his desperate attempt to evade the psychotic ex-colleague touches off a violent chain of events impacting the lives of several San Fernando Valley residents. Danny Aiello, James Spader, Eric Stoltz, Jeff Daniels, Teri Hatcher, Glenne Headley, Marsha Mason.

programme.title: The Watcher
programme.desc: Keanu Reeves and James Spader star in this haunting thriller about a serial killer. Troubled FBI agent Joel Campbell (Spader) goes up against a sadistic murderer (Reeves) who sends him photos of his next victims, giving him 24 hours to save them. Marisa Tomei, Ernie Hudson, Chris Ellis, Robert Cicchini, Yvonne Niami.

programme.title: Poltergeist III
programme.desc: A 12-year-old girl is troubled by ghostly sightings when she moves into a downtown Chicago high-rise with her aunt and uncle. But her private-school psychologist thinks she is delusional.

programme.title: Bloodsport
programme.desc: A portrait of Frank Dux, the first Westerner to win the Kumite, a deadly martial-arts contest. Based on actual events.

programme.title: Rush
programme.desc: A female rookie cop is paired with an undercover officer trying to infiltrate a drug kingpin's organization. He is forced to partake of illegal substances as part of his cover, and he's become a junkie. She follows him down this self-destructive path after they become lovers.

programme.title: A Walk Among the Tombstones
programme.desc: The thrills never stop when a NYC heroin trafficker hires a haunted ex-cop to find the men who abducted and killed his wife. But as the sleuth gets closer to his targets, he realizes that they're much more sinister than he could have imagined.

programme.title: New Year's Eve
programme.desc: Featuring an all-star cast including Robert De Niro, Katherine Heigl and Sarah Jessica Parker, this engaging comedy-drama follows a variety of couples and singles as they roam the streets of New York City on New Year's Eve.

programme.title: The Lovely Bones
programme.desc: This heart-wrenching drama centers on young teenager Susie Salmon, who is murdered by her neighbor and watches over her grieving parents from a heaven of her own creation. Susie must come to terms with her own death, while sharing the pain her father and mother are working through.

programme.title: Poltergeist II: The Other Side
programme.desc: The Freeling family is once again spooked by supernatural forces in this sequel to the 1982 blockbuster. They're back for Carol Anne, and this time the Beast takes the form of a sinister reverend.

programme.title: Tin Cup
programme.desc: Kevin Costner and Rene Russo light up the greens in this engaging romantic comedy. Pro golfer Roy "Tin Cup" McAvoy (Costner) falls for golf student Dr. Molly Griswold (Russo). To prove his love, he vows to win the U.S. Open, where David Simms---his lifelong rival and Molly's boyfriend---is competing. Cheech Marin, Don Johnson, Linda Hart.

programme.title: Braveheart
programme.desc: A fictionalized portrait of 13th-century Scottish rebel William Wallace, who led insurgents against oppressive English rule.

programme.title: Men in Black 3
programme.desc: In this action-packed installment of the sci-fi franchise, Agent J travels back in time to 1969 in order to prevent someone from rewriting the course of history. Along the way, he reunites with his partner Agent K, who in 1969 is a young man.

programme.title: Black Sheep
programme.desc: A gubernatorial candidate hires a campaign worker to keep his imbecilic brother out of trouble.

programme.title: Overcomer
programme.desc: Forced to take a new job, a high school basketball coach reluctantly agrees to coach cross-country, discovering an incredible talent in an unlikely troubled runner. With his outlook changing, John agrees to start training her for the biggest race of her life yet.

programme.title: 500 Days of Summer
programme.desc: Greeting-card copywriter Tom falls for his coworker Summer in this hilarious and highly unconventional romantic comedy. Tom is sure he's found his soul mate, but Summer claims not to believe in true love and is only interested in having some fun with Tom. The film moves forward and backward through various incidents in Tom and Summer's 500-day love affair.

programme.title: Harold & Kumar Go to White Castle
programme.desc: Two stoners with the munchies take a road trip through New Jersey in search of a hamburger joint in this hilarious and irreverent comedy. John Cho and Kal Penn star as the dazed and confused roommates; Jamie Kennedy and Neil Patrick Harris have cameos. Directed by Danny Leiner ("Dude, Where's My Car?").

programme.title: Made of Honor
programme.desc: All's fair in and love and war, so when a playboy (Patrick Dempsey) belatedly realizes he's in love with his best friend (Michelle Monaghan)---after she gets engaged to a hot Scot---he sets out to sabotage her elaborate wedding, a destination blowout at a Scottish castle. Kevin McKidd, Kadeem Hardison, Busy Philipps.

programme.title: Spy Kids
programme.desc: Director Robert Rodriguez ("From Dusk till Dawn") crafted this family film about a married pair of former secret agents (Antonio Banderas, Carla Gugino) whose espionage genes come in handy when their kids have to rescue them from a madman who wants to rule the world. Alan Cumming, Alexa Vega, Daryl Sabara, Tony Shalhoub, Teri Hatcher, Cheech Marin.

programme.desc: Forced to take a new job, a high school basketball coach reluctantly agrees to coach cross-country, discovering an incredible talent in an unlikely troubled runner. With his outlook changing, John agrees to start training her for the biggest race of her life yet.

programme.title: Two for the Money
programme.desc: Matthew McConaughey and Al Pacino bring their "A" games in this winning profile of a pair of high-profile, high-stakes sports handicappers. The former is an ex-college quarterback with a knack for covering the lines and the latter plays his wily mentor. The film, based on a true story, is directed by D.J. Caruso, and features an outstanding costarring turn by Rene Russo as Pacino's troubled wife. Russo also serves as one of the executive producers. Armand Assante, Jeremy Piven, Jaime King.

programme.desc: A gubernatorial candidate hires a campaign worker to keep his imbecilic brother out of trouble.

programme.title: Dawn of the Dead
programme.desc: Flesh-eating zombies terrorize a group of people who has taken refuge in a shopping mall in this suspenseful and stylish remake of George Romero's 1979 classic.

programme.title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider
programme.desc: Angelina Jolie stars as sexy Lara Croft in this high-tech action fantasy, based on the popular video game. The aristocratic adventuress battles a villainous secret society as she races to recover an ancient artifact with magic powers. Jolie's real-life father, Jon Voight, costars as Lara's dad, Lord Richard Croft. Iain Glen, Daniel Craig, Noah Taylor.

programme.title: Silver Streak
programme.desc: George, a mild-mannered guy on a cross-country train trip, becomes embroiled in a deadly adventure when he falls in love with Hilly, a woman on the verge of exposing art forgers. George must eventually team with a fast-talking criminal in order to outwit bad guys intending to kill both him and Hilly.

programme.title: Trading Places
programme.desc: Funny business about a snobby, wealthy investment broker unwittingly switching roles with a fast-talking street hustler as part of a whimsical wager orchestrated by two billionaire brothers, and then teaming up to exact revenge on the tycoons.

programme.title: The Golden Child
programme.desc: A social worker who finds missing children is tasked with tracking down a kidnapped magical Buddhist child and rescuing him from an evil sorcerer.

programme.title: The Nutty Professor
programme.desc: Overweight Professor Klump invents a formula that causes him to shed hundreds of pounds instantly and transforms him into an obnoxious alter ego. Though his studly shape gives him new confidence, he soon discovers the instability of his miracle potion. A comic twist on the Jekyll-and-Hyde tale and a semi-remake of the Jerry Lewis classic. Eddie Murphy, Jada Pinkett, James Coburn.

programme.title: Nutty Professor II: The Klumps
programme.desc: Eddie Murphy's delightful performances as eight characters and Rick Baker's dazzling makeup effects distinguish this sequel to 1996's "The Nutty Professor." In order to get married, portly genius Sherman Klump (Murphy) must rid himself of his alter ego, the conniving and libidinous Buddy Love (also Murphy). Janet Jackson, Larry Miller, John Ales.

programme.title: Daddy Day Care
programme.desc: Two guys who cut their teeth doing stand-up comedy and television, Eddie Murphy and Jeff Garlin, provide big laughs in this rollicking romp. They play out-of-work advertising executives who decide to get into the tyke-sitting business after hearing about the sorry state of quality child care in their neighborhood. The kiddie cast of adorable costars is outstanding.

programme.title: The Adventures of Pluto Nash
programme.desc: Dwindling resources are forcing people to move to the moon, where Pluto Nash is attempting to turn his life around as owner of the nightclub Little America. All is well until Pluto meets a gangster who won't back down about buying the nightclub, and who also has ties to crime boss Max Crater, whose mission is to take over the moon.

programme.title: 48 Hrs.
programme.desc: When cop killers escape prison, a detective enlists the help of a convict to help track them down...in 48 hours.

programme.title: Trading Places
programme.desc: Funny business about a snobby, wealthy investment broker unwittingly switching roles with a fast-talking street hustler as part of a whimsical wager orchestrated by two billionaire brothers, and then teaming up to exact revenge on the tycoons.

programme.title: White Men Can't Jump
programme.desc: A white con artist hustles basketball games against black players who don't realize he is actually a gifted hoopster, and one of his unsuspecting victims becomes his "agent," arranging his various scams around L.A., and the duo quickly start piling up the wins together.

programme.title: A Guy Thing
programme.desc: A groom-to-be attempts to piece together his wild bachelor party as the big date approaches.

programme.title: The Vow
programme.desc: This heartrending romantic drama follows a devoted husband (Channing Tatum) as he fights to win back his new bride's heart after she loses her memory in a tragic car accident.

programme.title: Seven Pounds
programme.desc: Will Smith reunites with "The Pursuit of Happyness" director Gabriele Muccino for this emotionally intense story of an IRS agent harboring a secret who embarks on a journey of redemption by trying to change the lives of seven strangers. Rosario Dawson, Woody Harrelson, Michael Ealy, Barry Pepper, Elpidia Carrillo.

programme.title: For Love of the Game
programme.desc: Kevin Costner slides into his third baseball-themed film, a well-crafted sentimental voyage which nicely blends romantic drama with intense on-field action. Costner plays aging Detroit Tigers hurler Billy Chapel, who takes the mound for the final game of the season---and maybe his career. As he strives to pitch a perfect game, Chapel reminisces about a whirlwind romance. Kelly Preston.

programme.title: White Men Can't Jump
programme.desc: A white con artist hustles basketball games against black players who don't realize he is actually a gifted hoopster, and one of his unsuspecting victims becomes his "agent," arranging his various scams around L.A., and the duo quickly start piling up the wins together.

programme.title: Bite the Bullet
programme.desc: A contrasting group of riders enter a 700-mile horse marathon across Southwest America. Mutual feelings of distrust and a difficult race through the desert puts each rider up to the ultimate test. Filmed in Nevada, Colorado and New Mexico.

programme.title: Public Enemies
programme.desc: Director Michael Mann's electrifying historical crime drama follows the efforts of top FBI agent Melvin Purvis in capturing notorious bank robber John Dillinger. A folk hero to the American public, Dillinger was virtually unstoppable at the height of his criminal career. J. Edgar Hoover's FBI was just being formed, and in order to turn his fledgling agency into a national police force, Hoover recruits Purvis to catch the most-elusive criminal in the country.

programme.title: Ronin
programme.desc: Robert De Niro stars in this explosive thriller directed by suspense specialist John Frankenheimer ("The Manchurian Candidate"). An international group of Cold War intelligence operatives are recruited by an IRA agent to obtain a mysterious briefcase. But they soon learn that their mission has been compromised by betrayal.

programme.title: Get Carter
programme.desc: Sylvester Stallone is at his most menacing in this slam-bang remake of the 1971 British crime drama. He plays Jack Carter, a debt collector who's investigating the death of his estranged brother. Michael Caine, who played Carter in the original, costars as the former employer of Carter's brother. Miranda Richardson, Rachael Leigh Cook, Alan Cumming, Mickey Rourke.

programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: Costars and co-writers Matt Damon and Ben Affleck won an Oscar for their tale of a charismatic genius (Damon) who lands in jail after a playground brawl. His hope for the future lies with a sympathetic therapist (Best Supporting Actor Robin Williams), who understands the young man's rebellious nature. Minnie Driver, Stellan Skarsgard, Casey Affleck.

programme.title: In the Long Run
programme.desc: The Easmons return for another round of cash-strapped strife in 80s London. (repeat).

programme.title: Meet the Blacks
programme.desc: After obtaining a great deal of money, a black man decides to move his family from Chicago to Beverly Hills. However, they are soon terrorized by home intruders who want them out of the affluent community in this hysterical spoof of the "Purge" films.

programme.title: Little Women
programme.desc: Four sisters learn about love, life, and loss as they grow through their young womanhood against the backdrop of post-Civil War America. At the heart of the family is the headstrong Jo who aspires, above all else, to forge her own path. Based on the novel by Louisa May Alcott.

programme.title: American Gods
programme.desc: As the search for the missing girl continues, Shadow dreams of Bilquis. Wednesday discovers the whereabouts of his old love, the Greek goddess Demeter, and resolves to free her from the grip of an unscrupulous antagonist. (repeat).

programme.title: Zombieland: Double Tap
programme.desc: Ten years after they joined forces to survive the zombie apocalypse, a makeshift and relatively dysfunctional family of seasoned zombie slayers travels to the American heartland to square off against other survivors and a variety of newly evolved zombies.

An ambitious journalist (Tea Leoni), investigating what she believes is a Washington sex scandal, discovers that a comet is going to hit Earth. While a team of scientists struggles to alter its course, families prepare for the end. Robert Duvall, Vanessa Redgrave, Morgan Freeman, Leelee Sobieski.

programme.title: Rent
programme.desc: The Tony-winning Broadway hit centering on the lives and loves of a group of struggling bohemians in New York's East Village is vibrantly brought to the screen in this dazzling musical featuring many of the original stage stars. Anthony Rapp, Adam Pascal, Rosario Dawson, Jesse L. Martin, Wilson Jermaine Heredia. Directed by Chris Columbus.

programme.desc: In the spine-chilling tradition of "The Sixth Sense" comes this haunting yarn about a troubled 9-year-old (Dakota Fanning) who blames recent unsettling events on her imaginary playmate. Robert De Niro costars as her psychologist dad who is dealing with the suicide of his wife (Amy Irving). John Polson directed. She must align with the most unlikely person in her community to outwit the thugs on a vengeful warpath and her fellow officers looking to hide the truth.

programme.title: The 24th *
programme.desc: In 1917, civil unrest begins to upend the city of Houston. When tensions boil over to full-fledged riots, the United States government deploys its Twenty-Fourth Infantry Regiment, comprised entirely of African-Americans, to quell the violence. The soldiers soon begin to question their role in suppressing the riots while remaining cognizant of the racial undercurrents of the violence. (new).

Simmons). Cliff Robertson, James Franco.

programme.desc: Detective Marcus Burnett confesses to his partner Mike Lowrey his plans to retire after celebrating the birth of his new grandson, until Lowrey suffers a shooting. programme.desc: While investigating a series of mysterious deaths in the suburbs, a female police detective realizes that a vengeful and malevolent ghost has followed her home. This dangerous spectral presence is the result of a curse that was activated by a gravely unjust death.

programme.title: American Wedding
programme.desc: The "American Pie" gang returns to tie the knot. Jim hopes to have his wedding day go smoothly by enlisting the help of his friends, but the results are quite the opposite.

programme.title: Reasonable Doubt
programme.desc: A hotshot district attorney contends with a killer following a deadly hit and run that ties their fates together in this white-knuckle thriller. After acquitting the accused of the crime that he himself committed, the DA finds his family in danger and his future in jeopardy.

programme.title: Dude, Where's My Car?
programme.desc: Two slackers have an excellent adventure in this riotous comedy. After a wild night they don't remember, dimwits Jesse (Ashton Kutcher) and Chester (Seann William Scott) search valiantly for Jesse's missing car. Along the way, they encounter a money-hungry transsexual stripper, a spacy group of extraterrestrial loonies and killer ostriches. Kristy Swanson, Hal Sparks.

programme.title: The Animal
programme.desc: Rob Schneider is hilarious in this comedy about Marvin Mange, an aspiring cop who undergoes "transspecies" surgery after a car accident. When he recovers, Mange has the physical prowess of a beast and must work feverishly to control his animal instincts if he is to win the heart of a perky environmental activist (Colleen Haskell). John C. McGinley, Edward Asner, Adam Sandler.

programme.desc: This endearing comedy finds a quirky crossword-puzzle constructor head over heels in love with a cameraman she follows across America, though it's the people she meets along the way who become her true soul mates.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: As she left choir practice, the woman was gunned down in the church parking lot. Her husband became the prime suspect, particularly when police learned he found out just a month earlier that his wife had been cheating on him for three years.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man perishes in a fire while working inside his garage. Initially, the coroner rules the death an accident. But a Forensic Odontologist changes the direction of the case, as police unravel a bizarre case of stolen identity.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When their trailer catches fire, the young husband heroically rescues his wife and infant son. A month later, his wife is beaten to death in a bedroom of his parents' home. The cut window screen points to an intruder, but there is a lack of evidence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: For 18 years, a man who murdered his entire family successfully eluded the FBI. Investigators used art and forensic science to find the killer and bring him to justice.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.desc: The world's worst baby sitter (Jonah Hill) takes a brood of rambunctious children (Max Records) on a wild night-time odyssey through New York.

programme.title: Unfaithful
programme.desc: A man (Richard Gere) becomes increasingly distraught after he discovers his wife (Diane Lane) is having an affair with a Frenchman (Olivier Martinez).

programme.title: 30 Coins
programme.desc: Vergara flees from Santoro and hides among soldiers and war hospitals in Syria; Elena follows Roque to Paris, but is terrified when the coin finds its way back to her; in Pedraza, Paco is about to resign when a sinister new priest arrives.

programme.title: The Lady and the Dale
programme.desc: Publicist for a three-wheeled fuel efficient car of the future, trans woman Liz Carmichael is outed as a fugitive who has spent decades running from the law with her family.

programme.title: The Lady and the Dale
programme.desc: With Liz at the helm, the 20th Century Motor Car Company launches The Dale, which soon rises in popularity; investigative reporters question the operation, leading to government attempts to reign in sales practices and a fatal shooting.

programme.title: Battleship
programme.desc: An epic adventure unfolds across the high seas, as American sailors (Taylor Kitsch, Alexander Skarsgård, Rihanna) go to war against an army of invading aliens.

programme.title: Painting With John
programme.desc: John recounts how the obsession he and his brother shared for John Coltrane's "Live at Birdland" resulted in an unfortunate Sunday breakfast, and chronicles his epic quest to procure a live eel in Manhattan.

programme.title: Walk of Shame
programme.desc: A woman's dream of becoming a news anchor is jeopardized by an ill-advised tryst that leaves her stranded in downtown Los Angeles with no money or transportation and only eight hours to make it to the most important job interview of her life.

programme.title: Tower Heist
programme.desc: The manager (Ben Stiller) of a luxury condominium joins forces with a petty crook (Eddie Murphy) to steal back the retirement money a Wall Street swindler stole from him and his co-workers.

programme.title: Mrs. Doubtfire
programme.desc: Estranged from his wife (Sally Field), an out-of-work actor (Robin Williams) masquerades as a nanny to be with his children.

programme.title: Victoria & Abdul
programme.desc: Queen Victoria faces disapproval from her inner circle after forging an unlikely and devoted friendship with Abdul Karim, a young clerk from India.

programme.title: City Slickers
programme.desc: On vacation, three men (Billy Crystal, Daniel Stern, Bruno Kirby) get to play cowboy on a dude-ranch cattle drive, but unexpected circumstances test their skills and stamina.

programme.title: Painting With John
programme.desc: John recounts how the obsession he and his brother shared for John Coltrane's "Live at Birdland" resulted in an unfortunate Sunday breakfast, and chronicles his epic quest to procure a live eel in Manhattan.

programme.title: Somewhere
programme.desc: A roguish actor (Stephen Dorff) has to re-examine his life of excesses when he gets an unexpected visit from his young daughter (Elle Fanning).

programme.title: Snow White and the Huntsman
programme.desc: Sent by an evil queen (Charlize Theron) to capture an escaped princess (Kristen Stewart), a huntsman (Chris Hemsworth) instead becomes the young woman's protector and helps her in her quest to regain control of her kingdom.

programme.title: REAL Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: David Scott examines Nike's controversial Oregon Project; a group of Minneapolis police officers coached Minneapolis North High School; athletes who continue to suffer debilitating symptoms months after contracting COVID-19.

programme.title: Ma
programme.desc: A lonely middle-aged woman befriends some teenagers and decides to let them party at her house. Just when the kids think their luck couldn't get any better, things start happening that make them question the intention of their host.

programme.title: Stop-Loss
programme.desc: A soldier (Ryan Phillippe) whose tour of duty has ended takes matters into his own hands when the Army tries to force him back into active duty in Iraq.

programme.title: Replicas
programme.desc: A brilliant neuroscientist secretly tries to clone and create replicas of his family after a tragic car crash.

programme.title: The Mummy
programme.desc: A young man (Brendan Fraser) opens a tomb unleashing a mummy seeking revenge for a curse laid upon him 3,000 years earlier.

programme.title: X-Men: Dark Phoenix
programme.desc: During a rescue mission, Jean Grey is hit by a cosmic force that makes her infinitely more powerful, but far more unstable. The X-Men must now unite to save her soul and battle aliens that want to utilize Grey's mysterious new abilities.

programme.title: City Island
programme.desc: Vince (Andy Garcia) brings home his secret ex-con son to meet the rest of his family, prompting everyone to expose truths.

programme.title: We Bought a Zoo
programme.desc: A widower (Matt Damon) relocates his family to a dilapidated zoo and, with the help of its eclectic staff, works to restore the facility to its former glory.

programme.title: Godzilla: King of the Monsters
programme.desc: Humanity's existence hangs in the balance when the mighty Godzilla collides with Mothra, Rodan and the three-headed monster King Ghidorah.

programme.title: Painting With John
programme.desc: After contemplating how to open his show, artist John Lurie discusses his parents' approach to nurturing their kids' creativity, and his lack of trust in someone until he has heard them laugh.

programme.title: Painting With John
programme.desc: John crashes his seventh drone in his attempt to film a show opening, shares how his cancer treatment led to a middle-of-the-night disastrous shrimp curry incident, and recalls meeting Barry White.

programme.title: Just Mercy
programme.desc: Lawyer Bryan Stevenson takes on the case of Walter McMillian, who is sentenced to die for murder despite evidence proving his innocence. In the years that follow, Stevenson encounters racism and legal maneuverings as he fights for McMillian's life.

programme.desc: A soldier (Ryan Phillippe) whose tour of duty has ended takes matters into his own hands when the Army tries to force him back into active duty in Iraq.

programme.title: C.B. Strike
programme.desc: Robin discovers a startling truth close to home; the government minister's blackmailer becomes the prime suspect in the case, but Robin and Strike believe there was an accomplice.

programme.title: Misery
programme.desc: An author (James Caan) recovers from an accident, nursed by a twisted fan (Kathy Bates) who insists he write a new book just for her.

programme.title: Us
programme.desc: A couple and their two children must fight for survival when four masked strangers descend upon their beachfront home. When the masks come off, the family is horrified to learn that each attacker takes the appearance of one of them.

programme.desc: Jules spends the Christmas holiday reflecting on the year.

programme.title: Downhill
programme.desc: A woman starts to have second doubts about her husband after he runs away from an approaching avalanche, leaving her and their two sons behind.

programme.title: Idiocracy
programme.desc: Selected for a human hibernation project, an average soldier (Luke Wilson) awakens 500 years in the future, where society is so dumbed-down that he is the smartest person alive.

programme.title: Pi
programme.desc: A Wall Street firm and a Hasidic sect hound a mathematical genius (Sean Gullette) seeking profundity on his computer.

programme.title: Death Sentence
programme.desc: A suburban businessman (Kevin Bacon) becomes a vigilante after thugs kill his son during a gas station robbery.

programme.title: Hero
programme.desc: Flashbacks reveal how a warrior (Jet Li) stopped the elusive assassins (Tony Leung Chiu Wai, Maggie Cheung Man-yuk) who tried to kill the emperor of China.

programme.title: Independence Day
programme.desc: A fighter pilot (Will Smith), a computer whiz (Jeff Goldblum) and others fight back after 15-mile-wide alien ships zap Earth's major cities.

programme.title: True Grit
programme.desc: A teenage girl enlists the aid of a boozy, trigger-happy lawman (Jeff Bridges) to hunt down her father's killer (Josh Brolin).

programme.title: Idlewild
programme.desc: In a 1930s speakeasy, a piano player (André Benjamin) and his fellow performer (Antwan A. Patton) try to keep their establishment out of hoodlums' hands.

programme.title: Little
programme.desc: Jordan is a take-no-prisoners mogul who torments her long-suffering assistant and employees on a daily basis. She soon faces an unexpected threat to her personal life and career when she magically transforms into a 13-year-old version of herself.

programme.title: Life of Pi
programme.desc: After the freighter they're on sinks in a storm, a teenager (Suraj Sharma) and a Bengal tiger wind up on a small lifeboat and must learn to trust each other to survive.

programme.title: Flight
programme.desc: A Jamaican boy dreams of flying to the moon.

programme.title: The Investigation
programme.desc: A home-built submarine with a female Swedish journalist and the submarine builder on board disappears.

programme.title: Painting With John

programme.title: Never Rarely Sometimes Always
programme.desc: Faced with an unintended pregnancy and a lack of local support, Autumn and her cousin, Skylar, travel across state lines to New York City on a fraught journey of friendship, bravery and compassion.

programme.title: This Must Be the Place
programme.desc: A guilt-ridden, aging rock star (Sean Penn) takes on his late father's quest to track down a Nazi war criminal.

programme.title: Suicide Kings
programme.desc: Four wealthy young men take a New York crime boss (Christopher Walken) hostage, planning to trade him for one's (Henry Thomas) kidnapped sister.

programme.title: Grand Canyon
programme.desc: Los Angeles denizens cross paths, including a lawyer (Kevin Kline) and a tow-truck driver (Danny Glover) who inadvertently saves his life.

programme.title: Drumline
programme.desc: A young man from Harlem (Nick Cannon) joins a Southern university's marching band but antagonizes the musical director (Orlando Jones) and its leader.

programme.title: Evelyn X Evelyn
programme.desc: A couple mourn the loss of their child.

programme.title: Cats
programme.desc: A tribe of cats must decide yearly which one will ascend to the Heaviside Layer and come back to a new life. Live action/animated.

programme.title: Timeline
programme.desc: Adventurers (Paul Walker, Frances O'Connor, Gerard Butler) travel back to 14th-century France to save a professor caught in the middle of a war.

programme.title: Sleight
programme.desc: After his mother's death, a young street magician (Jacob Latimore) turns to dealing drugs at parties to support his little sister. When she is kidnapped by his supplier, he uses his sleight of hand and keen intelligence to find her.

programme.title: Fake Famous
programme.desc: Exploring the industry of social media influencers with an innovative social experiment -- three people in Los Angeles with relatively small social followings attempt to become famous influencers by purchasing fake followers and an army of bots.

programme.title: The Way Back
programme.desc: Stuck in a meaningless job and struggling with alcoholism, a former high school athlete gets a shot at redemption when he becomes the basketball coach for his alma mater, a program that has since fallen on hard times.

programme.title: Painting With John
programme.desc: John recounts how the obsession he and his brother shared for John Coltrane's "Live at Birdland" resulted in an unfortunate Sunday breakfast, and chronicles his epic quest to procure a live eel in Manhattan.

programme.title: The Lady and the Dale
programme.desc: Publicist for a three-wheeled fuel efficient car of the future, trans woman Liz Carmichael is outed as a fugitive who has spent decades running from the law with her family.

programme.title: The Lady and the Dale
programme.desc: With Liz at the helm, the 20th Century Motor Car Company launches The Dale, which soon rises in popularity; investigative reporters question the operation, leading to government attempts to reign in sales practices and a fatal shooting.

programme.title: Just My Luck
programme.desc: A young woman (Lindsay Lohan), who has always led a charmed life, suffers a reversal of fortune after kissing a stranger (Chris Pine) at a costume party.

programme.title: Up in the Air
programme.desc: A corporate downsizing expert (George Clooney) realizes he is developing real feelings for a frequent bedmate (Vera Farmiga) whose cache of travel miles and club cards rivals his own.

programme.title: Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy
programme.desc: Called back from retirement, veteran British spy George Smiley (Gary Oldman) must ferret out a mole in MI6, who has been feeding vital information to the Soviets.

programme.title: Little Children
programme.desc: A dissatisfied housewife (Kate Winslet) and the husband (Patrick Wilson) of a documentary filmmaker (Jennifer Connelly) have secret trysts while their spouses are at work.

programme.title: Queen & Slim
programme.desc: Slim and Queen's first date takes an unexpected turn when one shoots a policeman during a routine traffic stop. Now labeled cop killers in the media, the unwitting outlaws feel that they have no choice but to go on the run and evade the law.

programme.title: The Apollo
programme.desc: Filmmaker Roger Ross Williams looks at the storied history of the iconic Apollo Theater while following the Apollo's inaugural staging of Ta-Nehisi Coates' acclaimed "Between the World and Me.".

programme.title: Billy Elliot
programme.desc: A working-class youngster (Jamie Bell) in 1984 England discovers a hidden talent for dance with the help of a hard-bitten teacher (Julie Walters).

programme.title: The Last Exorcism
programme.desc: While a film crew documents his final days as an exorcist, a deceitful cleric (Patrick Fabian) must summon true faith when he encounters real evil at a Louisiana farm.

programme.title: 40 Days and 40 Nights
programme.desc: A young man (Josh Hartnett) meets the girl (Shannyn Sossamon) of his dreams after vowing to avoid any physical contact with women during Lent.

programme.title: Fifty Shades of Black
programme.desc: In a spoof of "Fifty Shades of Grey," wealthy entrepreneur Christian Black (Marlon Wayans) introduces a young woman (Kali Hawk) to his kinky world of S&M.

programme.title: Independence Day
programme.desc: A fighter pilot (Will Smith), a computer whiz (Jeff Goldblum) and others fight back after 15-mile-wide alien ships zap Earth's major cities.

programme.title: The Hurricane
programme.desc: Aided by a Brooklyn teen (Vicellous Reon Shannon) and three Canadians, boxer Rubin Carter (Denzel Washington) fights to be exonerated after long imprisonment for murders he did not commit.

programme.title: Idlewild
programme.desc: In a 1930s speakeasy, a piano player (André Benjamin) and his fellow performer (Antwan A. Patton) try to keep their establishment out of hoodlums' hands.

programme.title: Kareem: Minority of One
programme.desc: The life and career of the NBA's all-time leading scorer, Kareem Abdul-Jabbar.

programme.title: The Hard Way
programme.desc: A Hollywood star (Michael J. Fox) of action movies tags along with a New York police detective (James Woods) to see the real thing.

programme.title: Beasts of the Southern Wild
programme.desc: The father of an intrepid youngster (Quvenzhané Wallis) prepares her for the end of the world, when melting ice caps release fearsome beasts, called aurochs, and rising flood waters threaten to engulf their Delta home.

programme.title: The Girl With All the Gifts
programme.desc: In the future, a strange fungus has changed nearly everyone into a thoughtless, flesh-eating monster. When a scientist and a teacher find a girl who seems to be immune to the fungus, they all begin a journey to save humanity.

programme.title: Annabelle: Creation
programme.desc: Years after the tragic death of their daughter, a former toy maker and his wife welcome a nun and six orphaned girls into their farmhouse. Terror soon strikes when one child finds a seemingly innocent doll that appears to have a life of its own.

programme.title: I Used to Go Here
programme.desc: A successful author finds herself deeply enmeshed in the lives of a group of college students after being asked to speak at her alma mater.

programme.title: Bessie
programme.desc: Blues singer Bessie Smith (Queen Latifah) rises to fame in the 1920s to become a musical legend.

programme.title: Butter
programme.desc: The wife (Jennifer Garner) of a longtime butter-carving champion (Ty Burrell) vows to win an Iowa contest herself after her husband retires from competition.

programme.title: The Lucky One
programme.desc: A war veteran (Zac Efron) pursues a romance with the woman (Taylor Schilling) whose photograph he believes helped him survive his tour of duty in Iraq.

programme.title: Hot Fuzz
programme.desc: A British constable (Simon Pegg) feels certain foul play is afoot when a series of grisly accidents rocks his quiet village.

programme.title: American Pie
programme.desc: Four teenagers nearing graduation make a pact to lose their virginity by prom night.

programme.title: American Pie 2
programme.desc: Old friends gather after their freshman year in college to rent a summerhouse on Lake Michigan and chase girls.

programme.title: American Reunion
programme.desc: Jim (Jason Biggs), Stifler and their former classmates from East Great Falls learn what has changed and what has not when they gather for their high-school reunion.

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: Wrongly convicted of murder, two men (Eddie Murphy, Martin Lawrence) become close friends during decades in a Mississippi penitentiary.

programme.title: Class
programme.desc: A preppie (Andrew McCarthy) acts like a Ph.D. candidate in a bar and picks up an older woman (Jacqueline Bisset), his roommate's (Rob Lowe) mother.

programme.title: Boycott
programme.desc: The Rev. Martin Luther King Jr. leads a protest against public transportation after Rosa Parks refuses to surrender her bus seat in 1955 Montgomery, Ala.

programme.title: Shazam!
programme.desc: Billy Batson is a streetwise 14-year-old who can magically transform into the adult superhero Shazam simply by shouting out one word. His newfound powers soon get put to the test when he squares off against the evil Dr. Thaddeus Sivana.

programme.title: Rock of Ages
programme.desc: Songs by Def Leppard, Journey, Joan Jett, Bon Jovi and others underscore a rock 'n' roll romance between a small-town girl (Julianne Hough) and a city boy (Diego Boneta) who meet on the Sunset Strip while chasing their Hollywood dreams.

programme.title: The Crow
programme.desc: A black bird resurrects a rock musician (Brandon Lee) who then avenges his own murder and his fiancee's.

programme.title: Swimfan
programme.desc: A new student (Erika Christensen) at a high school obsesses over a swimming champion (Jesse Bradford) who does not return her advances.

programme.title: Stockton on My Mind
programme.desc: Michael Tubbs works tirelessly to effect change after he becomes the first African American mayor of Stockton, Calif.

programme.title: Beavis and Butt-head Do America
programme.desc: Beavis and Butt-head travel from Las Vegas to Washington, D.C., not realizing that their landlord has sent them to kill his wife. Animated.

Rooted
programme.desc: Learn the story of the tree with the ‘Hollow Heart’. Baobabs have been around for eight hundred years and survive extreme drought by storing water in their trunks, which elephants break off to eat in drier seasons. Luckily, this tree can heal itself.

programme.title: Kingdom Of The Tide
programme.desc: Low tide exposes a band of shore called the intertidal zone. It’s a place of stunning extremes, attacked by hurricane force waves and exposed to baking heat. Creatures here have evolved in countless bizarre ways. Scientists explore this alien realm.

programme.title: Coastal Africa
programme.desc: At the southern tip of Africa lies an underwater forest of haunting beauty. Venture into the depths of this singular world of strange plants and exotic sex-changing fish as they take refuge in this fertile and unique ecosystem.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Witness veterinarian Dr. Amanda Salb save an elephant calf caught in a poacher’s snare, racing time to treat the wound. Back at the base, an orphaned baby baboon meets his new family. A monitor lizard and duiker are returned to freedom in the wild.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Amanda puts a radio collar on one of the first cheetah cubs born in Malawi in twenty years and the team struggles to give a 4-meter python a physical. See a group of tourists deliver a rambunctious baby monkey they rescued from the pet trade.

programme.title: Kingdom Of The Tide

programme.title: Pridelands: Wilderness Reborn
programme.desc: Meet a couple determined to rescue the planet by returning it to the wild. See how they transform a derelict farm in South Africa from a place where animals were once hunted to a stunning wildlife sanctuary.

programme.title: The Great Elephant Tale
programme.desc: Follow the adventures of three elephants across three very distinct African habitats. Their travels combine to tell the story of how these emotional and intelligent creatures evolved over millions of years to survive on the continent.

programme.title: Reef Wrecks
programme.desc: From opportunistic pirate ships to well-armed navy vessels, the Yucatan Peninsula is home to a variety of reef wrecks. With moray eels, schools of rays, and thousands of other creatures, these sunken ships have become vibrant marine habitats.
