programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: A curious raccoon sticks his head a little too far into a peanut butter jar on a sweltering summer day in Toronto. See how the team gets him out of this sticky situation. Then cheer on a painted turtle who needs emergency eye surgery.

programme.title: Ol Pejeta Diaries
programme.desc: Take a careful look at the plight of chimpanzees that survive the bushmeat trade only to become captive animals. At the same time, follow the reintroduction of colobus monkeys into the Ewaso river area of the reserve.

programme.title: Nature Scenes
programme.desc: One half hour of uninterrupted butterfly gardens. Enjoy stunning close ups of dozens of different butterfly and caterpillar species surrounded by waterfalls and exotic plants and flowers.

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Follow the medical and rehab teams at Toronto Wildlife Centre as they work to clear a rescued fox of mange and return it to the wild. Elsewhere in the centre, meet scores of injured songbirds that have hit downtown buildings on their way south.

programme.title: Ol Pejeta Diaries
programme.desc: Find out why hunger-ravaged leopards plague a local community. As the leopards roam dangerously close to nearby villages, the conservationist team attempts to safely snare a single leopard to relocate it for the good of man and beast.

programme.title: Life's Journey
programme.desc: Surviving infancy presents the greatest challenge for nearly every species on earth. The balance between life and death is easily tipped in the wilds of Africa, where animals must grow and learn quickly to make it through the first stage of life.

programme.title: Life's Journey
programme.desc: Young animals in Zambia face the great challenge of reaching maturity in order to breed, and every lesson learned could mean the difference between life and death. Coming of age for these creatures requires skill, strength, courage, and copious luck.

programme.title: A Wild Year On Earth
programme.desc: In the early months of the year, the Earth’s axial tilt brings the height of summer in some places and the depths of winter in others. See how life struggles to survive under these extreme conditions.

programme.title: A Wild Year On Earth
programme.desc: Travel around the globe to witness the atmospheric shifts that take place in March, from the wave of cherry blossoms that unfold across Japan to the final raft of green sea turtles that arrive on the Great Barrier Reef islands to lay eggs.

programme.title: A Wild Year On Earth
programme.desc: Watch summer unfold in the Northern Hemisphere, while regions close to the equator enter the wet season and Southern Africa goes dry, creating scarcity for some creatures and bounty for others.

programme.title: A Wild Year On Earth
programme.desc: Witness some of the planet’s most dramatic natural shifts in July, from the Arctic ice sheets that come crashing down during the summer melt to the feeding frenzy when sockeye salmon reach the end of their journey in Alaska.

programme.title: A Wild Year On Earth
programme.desc: Travel around the world to see another seasonal change unfold. The Northern Hemisphere moves into autumn, while Australia witnesses a rebirth of life, and mating humpbacks fill the warming tropical seas of Tonga.

programme.title: A Wild Year On Earth
programme.desc: Witness some of the most incredible natural events in November, from the millions of Monarch butterflies that converge in Mexico’s forests to the deep fog that shrouds the city of Dubai, signalling the start of winter.

programme.title: Kingdom Of The Tide
programme.desc: Low tide exposes a band of shore called the intertidal zone. It’s a place of stunning extremes, attacked by hurricane force waves and exposed to baking heat. Creatures here have evolved in countless bizarre ways. Scientists explore this alien realm.

programme.title: America's Wild Border: Northern Exposure
programme.desc: Trail Atlantic puffins, Prairie rattlesnakes, Alaskan caribou, and other animals as they travel across the international boundary between the U.S. and Canada. See how they can move from safety to target by crossing a line they had no say in creating.

programme.title: Wild Tales From The Farm
programme.desc: It’s spring, and the farm is bursting with new life. Watch a ewe give birth to twins, an orphaned Hereford calf struggle to find a surrogate mother, and the top hen nestle down in her maternity coop.

programme.title: Wild Tales From The Farm
programme.desc: Experience life on the farm as things heat up for summer. Watch animals swelter in a rare heatwave, try to stay cool in the nearby freshwater stream, and stash supplies for fall.

programme.title: Wild Crusades
programme.desc: Hidden in the jungles of Sri Lanka is a charismatic monkey: the toque macaque. Each macaque is unique, from its facial features to social skills. With increasing human contact, see how the monkeys lives are being affected in unexpected ways.

programme.title: Monkey Island
programme.desc: The 40-strong King troop has the run of the Sri Lankan temple ruins they call home, but Ana, whose new baby is due any day, is at the bottom of the pecking order. Follow her struggle to find food during the most difficult dry season in years.

programme.title: Monkey Island
programme.desc: A teenage toque macaque has led an idyllic life in the ancient Sri Lankan temples his troop calls home. But as adulthood approaches, he’ll soon have to leave the safety of the ruins and find a new troop. Join his journey into a daunting new world.

programme.title: Monkey Island
programme.desc: Tensions rise when drought overtakes an ancient Sri Lankan temple shared by tufted grey langurs, toque macaques, and purple-faced leaf monkeys. Witness the drama as the lower-ranking primates struggle to stay hydrated amid a mutinous plot.

programme.title: Nature Scenes
programme.desc: One half hour of uninterrupted aerials of Chile's beautiful Atacama Desert. Soar over the desert landscape rich with mountains,salt lakes, geysers, flamingos and guanacos.

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Follow along as the wildlife rehab team works to treat a baby raccoon, separated from his family, and get him back in the wild before his parents move on. In another part of the centre, watch as an orphaned killdeer is introduced to...himself?

programme.title: Ol Pejeta Diaries
programme.desc: Witness the troubles that arise after a once-in-a-generation drought has sucked all the moisture from surrounding rivers. The conservationists struggle to keep up with the number of thirsty animals as some succumb and others survive.

programme.title: Over Australia
programme.desc: From the vast, dry plains of the interior come some of Australia’s most recognized imagery, such as the monolithic red rock of Uluru and the bounding red kangaroo. But how did the arid centre of the continent come to be?

programme.title: Over Australia
programme.desc: Created by titanic forces and spanning 3,700 km along the eastern edge of Australia, the Great Dividing Range separates two very different worlds. Aerial footage and intimate studies reveal how species survive and thrive in this mountain home.

programme.title: Secret Life of the Kangaroo
programme.desc: Eastern Grey kangaroos are prolific breeders, but bringing up baby is fraught with challenges. Predators, climate extremes, and lively joeys mean kangaroo mothers face a daily struggle to keep their young alive.

programme.title: Secret Life of the Kangaroo
programme.desc: Follow several different males as they roam the land, climb up the social ladder, and fight for their mating rights in Eastern Grey colony. For these bucks, the drive to perpetuate their species promises a life full of risk and reward.

programme.title: Secrets Of Wild Australia
programme.desc: With more than 300 species, the snakes of Australia are as diverse and striking as the landscape they inhabit. Discover their clever hunting techniques, along with the ways their favourite prey, lizards, have evolved to outwit them.

programme.title: Secrets Of Wild Australia
programme.desc: Descended from the Asian wolf, dingoes have been in Australia for over three thousand years. As apex predators, they keep feral animal numbers in check, but the introduction of non-native sheep and cattle has caused them problems.

programme.title: Secrets Of Wild Australia
programme.desc: Crocodiles are formidable predators, superbly adapted with skull-crushing jaws and lightning speed. They were on Earth long before the dinosaurs, and have outlived them by millions of years. Now protected in Australia, their numbers have surged.

programme.title: After The Wildfires
programme.desc: Charting the long-term recovery of wildlife in the aftermath of Australia’s catastrophic bushfires through stories of hope, human intervention and resilience, this film provides an urgent message to safeguard our environment before it is too late.

programme.title: Secret Life of the Wombat
programme.desc: In the cool highlands near Australia’s Snowy Mountains is Wombat Wood. There, dotted amongst the trees and dense foliage, are over a hundred wombat burrows. But when some of the burrows are flooded, the wombats need to find safety.

programme.title: Secret Life of the Wombat
programme.desc: Wombats are solitary, slow-moving creatures, but breeding time brings out their energy, aggression and lots of play. Meet a southern hairy-nosed wombat named Birri, who’s trying to find a mate, along with a female named Winnie and her joey, Fred.

programme.title: Wild Tales From The Farm
programme.desc: Watch life on the farm adjust as the leaves start to turn, from the sheep whose woolly coats keep them warm during the first frost to the bees that feed on the last bit of nectar before hibernation.

programme.title: Wild Tales From The Farm
programme.desc: Winter is coming, and the animals take advantage of autumn’s final bounty before the cold, barren months ahead. Watch some creatures search for respite indoors, while others arrive from far northern climates to settle in the ploughed fields.

programme.title: Secrets Of Wild Australia
programme.desc: With more than 300 species, the snakes of Australia are as diverse and striking as the landscape they inhabit. Discover their clever hunting techniques, along with the ways their favourite prey, lizards, have evolved to outwit them.

programme.title: Rewilding
programme.desc: Europe’s biggest terrestrial mammal and the last wild bovine species on the continent was hunted to extinction. But thanks to ambitious rewilding, the European Bison has been re-introduced to its natural habitat for a dramatic return home.

programme.title: Rewilding
programme.desc: Discover The Steinhuder Meer, a biodiversity hotspot in Germany. Here, a combination of habitats such as fenlands, alder march, and dunes create a richly textured landscape ideal for the reintroduction species that were once extinct.

programme.title: Rewilding
programme.desc: Visit Andalusia-a mosaic of extreme habitats where human activities once severely impacted the landscape and fauna. Today, many previously near-extinct animals are reclaiming this unique land after forming innovative survival strategies.

programme.title: Secrets Of Wild Australia
programme.desc: With more than 300 species, the snakes of Australia are as diverse and striking as the landscape they inhabit. Discover their clever hunting techniques, along with the ways their favourite prey, lizards, have evolved to outwit them.

programme.title: Nature Scenes
programme.desc: One half hour of uninterrupted footage of Chile's stunning Atacama Desert. Discover the rich landscape of wide desert valleys and towering mountains.

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Join the rescue team as they respond to a call about an opossum stuck in a fence that turns out not to be the kind of animal that plays dead. Inside the centre, a goose with a serious foot injury receives physiotherapy before returning to the wild.

programme.title: Ol Pejeta Diaries
programme.desc: Explore eco-tourism, the financial backbone that keeps the park operating. Visit the varying accommodations, from comfortable camping to luxurious lodgings, and see how guests are living amongst nature and even assist in tracking wildlife.

programme.title: Wild Rockies
programme.desc: Herds of elk and moose live side-by side with predators such as bears and wolves in the Rockies. See elk and osprey try to find food in the Kootenay area, and discover why removing wolves from an ecosystem can have huge repercussions.

programme.title: A nap hőse (?)
programme.desc: Nem csak idősebb korunkra válhatunk példaképpé, sokan már tizenévesen azok lesznek! A DIGI Sport minisorozata olyan fiatal tehetségeket mutat be, akik teljesítményükkel, eredményeikkel kiemelkednek a kortársaik közül. A minisorozat különálló, 5-7 perces epizódjaiban ilyen fiatalokról láthatnak portrékat a nézőink. Az egyes portrékban bemutatjuk a főszereplőt, megismerjük a sportágát, megkérdezzük tapasztalatairól, bemutatjuk az eddig elért eredményeit, megmutatjuk környezetét, betekintünk edzéseire, megismerjük és meghallgatjuk az edzőjét és akár hozzátartozóit, családját is.

programme.title: Tenisz - WTA-torna (?)
programme.desc: (Élő).

programme.title: Tenisz - WTA-torna (?)
programme.desc: (Élő).

programme.title: S.E.F.T. (?)
programme.desc: A DIGI Sport új, napi rendszerességgel jelentkező magazinműsora komoly küldetéssel indul útjára. Célunk, hogy olyan inspiráló személyeket mutassunk be, akik _ legyenek akár profi vagy hobbisportolók, fiatalok vagy idősek, hírességek vagy civilek _ minden nap tesznek valamit az egészségükért. A műsorban nagyító alá vesszük a szereplők általános szemléletmódját, táplálkozását, sportolási szokásait, valamint ellessük apró praktikáikat, amelyekkel be tudják illeszteni a sportos, egészséges és fitt, azaz a #sefter életmódot rohanó hétköznapjaikba.

Thunderstrike Fight League 18, Kozienice, Poland, 28.09.2019
programme.desc: TFL 18 is the eighteenth edition of the MMA professional Thunderstrike Fight League. During this event, mixed martial arts fights were played in a professional octagon, including several fights with players from Poland and other European countries.

programme.title: Rxf
programme.desc: Real Xtreme Fighting (RXF), the largest promotion in Romania and the undisputed leader in the organization of events dedicated to Mixed Martial Arts (MMA), is pleased to invite you on RXF Gala.

programme.title: Hip Show
programme.desc: Hip Show takes combat sports to a whole new level. The fights are 2-on-2 (two teams of two fighters each) in a 3D 12x12 meters arena rather than inside a conventional flat ring. If one of the team members in the arena drops out after a knockout, the fight continues in a 2 versus 1 format. If the remaining team member can hold out for 60 seconds, the bout ends in a tie.

programme.title: Fighting Rookies 2014
programme.desc: Fighting Rookies is a competition with a unique chance for a kickboxer to clim the ladder of success in his sport. The Rookies compete for a chance to become professionals and get the experience needed to succeed at the highest level. Each fighter gives his best to turn his dream into reality. What they do today builds their future and echoes into eternity!

Incredible fights, powerful emotions, and high adrenaline is what every fighter and fan gets with the KOK Grand Prix Tournament Series.

programme.title: Wgp Kickboxing Brazil, Ep. 8
programme.desc: WGP Kickboxing Brazil is the premier kickboxing promotion in Latin America. Promoted since 2011, endorsed by the Brazilian Kickboxing Confederation and WAKO PRO, the promotion organizes several professional kickboxing events with the best athletes of Latin America and of the world, coming from World’s leading Kickboxing powers, such as the Netherlands, Russia, Morocco, etc.

programme.title: World Grand Prix Fight Tna, Tatneft Arena, Kazan, Russia, 24.08.2018
programme.desc: TATNEFT CUP tournament takes place in Kazan (Russia) at the "Tatneft Arena" in Ice Sports Palace. Several fights are scheduled for the event in three weight categories involving fighters from Russia, Turkey, Israel, Serbia, Romania and Belarus.

programme.title: Enfusion ’97 Talents, Alkmaar, Netherlands, 19.09.2020
programme.desc: Enfusion Kickboxing is one of the world’s top Kickboxing organizations. Live events take place all over the world and include Enfusion Live and Enfusion Talent which are both full events of about 2 hours held on the same night. Enfusion represents the highest quality kickboxing in the world, as their shows constantly feature the best and most exciting line-ups possible. The exciting atmosphere, spectacular action and jaw-dropping KO's are the main reason tor the brand's success. Enfusion is a must-see event for all combat sports enthusiasts.

programme.desc: NEW Wrestling's (New European Championship Wrestling) most hardcore event of the year. The word “violence” has a whole new meaning when top NEW stars and international talent meet in extreme stipulation matches.

programme.title: Bangkok Fight Night
programme.desc: Located in the impressive MBK Center in the heart of the Bangkok shopping district, thousands flock to witness the incredible Muay Thai events put on by Bangkok Fight Night every week. The combination of the unique location, hard hitting action and curious onlookers make Bangkok Fight Night an unforgettable experience. Don’t miss the “Science of the Eight Limbs” direct from Thailand!

programme.title: Hard Knocks Fighting, Ep. 7
programme.desc: HKFC is one of the world’s premier MMA promotions, showcasing elite up and coming athletes on a global stage. With over 50 events, HKFC, has earned a reputation of being a world class organization, through its global audience and draw of talent. Athletes such as Ronda Rousey, Elias Theodorou, and Misha Cirkunov used HKFC as a staging ground for their UFC careers.

programme.title: Acb Kb 16 Clash Of Titans, Targoviste, Romania, 13.07.2018
programme.desc: July 13 in Târgoviște will be held the tournament in professional kickboxing ACB KB-16: Clash of Titans. Loud slogan means loud fight card which will gather the most competitive kickboxers from Romania, Russia and Europe. In the main event of the evening the star of Romanian kickboxing Andrei Stoica will demonstrate the power of the heavyweight division. The legend of K-1 Albert Kraus will please all fans with a quality and uncompromising fight and this is not the entire list of high-class kickboxers who will perform at this event.

programme.title: Punch Down 1, Poznań, Poland, 14.12.2019
programme.desc: WHAT IS PUNCHDOWN? The main idea of the competition is to have fun! Participants compete with each other on the rules of the knockout stage (bracket) in 1vs1 duels, hitting each other on the cheek with an open hand, maximum 3 blows per person. The winner is decided by a knock-out or a judge's verdict.
